verses.verse: "Do you know <S%H3045><s%> the time <S%H6256><s%> the mountain <S%H3277><s%> <S%H5553><s%> goats <S%H3277><s%> give <S%H3205><s%> birth <S%H3205><s%>? Do you observe <S%H8104><s%> the calving <S%H9123><s%> of the deer <S%H355><s%>?
"Can you count <S%H5608><s%> the months <S%H3391><s%> they fulfill, <S%H4390><s%> Or do you know <S%H3045><s%> the time <S%H6256><s%> they give <S%H3205><s%> birth <S%H3205><s%>?

"They kneel <S%H3766><s%> down, <S%H3766><s%> they bring <S%H6398><s%> forth <S%H6398><s%> their young, <S%H3206><s%> They get <S%H7971><s%> rid <S%H7971><s%> of their labor <S%H2256><s%> pains. <S%H2256><s%>

"Their offspring <S%H1121><s%> become <S%H9138><s%> strong, <S%H9138><s%> they grow <S%H7235><s%> up in the open <S%H9062><s%> field; <S%H9062><s%> They leave <S%H3318><s%> and do not return <S%H7725><s%> to them.

"Who <S%H4310><s%> sent <S%H7971><s%> out the wild <S%H6501><s%> donkey <S%H6501><s%> free <S%H2670><s%>? And who <S%H4310><s%> loosed <S%H6605><s%> the bonds <S%H4147><s%> of the swift <S%H6171><s%> donkey, <S%H6171><s%>
To whom <S%H834><s%> I gave <S%H7760><s%> the wilderness <S%H6160><s%> for a home, <S%H1004><s%> And the salt <S%H4420><s%> land <S%H4420><s%> for his dwelling <S%H4908><s%> place <S%H4908><s%>?
"He scorns <S%H7832><s%> the tumult <S%H1995><s%> of the city, <S%H7151><s%> The shoutings <S%H8663><s%> of the driver <S%H5065><s%> he does not hear. <S%H8085><s%>
"He explores <S%H8446><s%> the mountains <S%H2022><s%> for his pasture, <S%H4829><s%> And he searches <S%H1875><s%> after <S%H310><s%> every <S%H3605><s%> green <S%H3387><s%> thing. <S%H3387><s%>
"Will the wild <S%H7214><s%> ox <S%H7214><s%> consent <S%H14><s%> to serve <S%H5647><s%> you? Or <S%H518><s%> will he spend <S%H3885><s%> the night <S%H3885><s%> at your manger <S%H18><s%>?

"Can you bind <S%H7194><s%> the wild <S%H7214><s%> ox <S%H7214><s%> in a furrow <S%H8525><s%> with ropes <S%H5688><s%>? Or <S%H518><s%> will he harrow <S%H7702><s%> the valleys <S%H6010><s%> after <S%H310><s%> you?
"Will you trust <S%H539><s%> him because <S%H3588><s%> his strength <S%H3581><s%> is great <S%H7227><s%> And leave <S%H5800><s%> your labor <S%H3018><s%> to him?
"Will you have <S%H539><s%> faith <S%H539><s%> in him that he will return <S%H7725><s%> your grain, <S%H2233><s%> And gather <S%H622><s%> [it from] your threshing <S%H1637><s%> floor <S%H1637><s%>?
"The ostriches' wings <S%H3671><s%> flap <S%H5965><s%> joyously <S%H5965><s%> With the pinion <S%H84><s%> and plumage <S%H5133><s%> of love, <S%H2623><s%>
For she abandons <S%H5800><s%> her eggs <S%H1000><s%> to the earth, <S%H776><s%> And warms <S%H2552><s%> them in the dust, <S%H6083><s%>
And she forgets <S%H7911><s%> that a foot <S%H7272><s%> may crush <S%H2115><s%> them, Or that a wild <S%H7704><s%> beast <S%H9130><s%> may trample <S%H1758><s%> them.

"She treats <S%H7188><s%> her young <S%H1121><s%> cruelly, <S%H7188><s%> as if [they] were not hers; Though her labor <S%H3018><s%> be in vain, <S%H7385><s%> [she] is unconcerned <S%H1097><s%>; <S%H6343><s%>
Because <S%H3588><s%> God <S%H433><s%> has made her forget <S%H5382><s%> wisdom, <S%H2451><s%> And has not given <S%H2505><s%> her a share <S%H2505><s%> of understanding. <S%H998><s%>
"When <S%H6256><s%> she lifts <S%H4754><s%> herself on high, <S%H4791><s%> She laughs <S%H7832><s%> at the horse <S%H5483><s%> and his rider. <S%H7392><s%>
"Do you give <S%H5414><s%> the horse <S%H5483><s%> [his] might <S%H1369><s%>? Do you clothe <S%H3847><s%> his neck <S%H6677><s%> with a mane <S%H7483><s%>?
"Do you make him leap <S%H7493><s%> like the locust <S%H697><s%>? His majestic <S%H1935><s%> snorting <S%H5170><s%> is terrible. <S%H367><s%>
"He paws <S%H2658><s%> in the valley, <S%H6010><s%> and rejoices <S%H7797><s%> in [his] strength; <S%H3581><s%> He goes <S%H3318><s%> out to meet <S%H7122><s%> the weapons. <S%H5402><s%>
"He laughs <S%H7832><s%> at fear <S%H6343><s%> and is not dismayed; <S%H2865><s%> And he does not turn <S%H7725><s%> back <S%H7725><s%> from the sword. <S%H2719><s%>
"The quiver <S%H827><s%> rattles <S%H7439><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> him, The flashing <S%H3851><s%> spear <S%H2595><s%> and javelin. <S%H3591><s%>

"With shaking <S%H7494><s%> and rage <S%H7267><s%> he races <S%H1572><s%> over the ground; <S%H776><s%> And he does not stand <S%H539><s%> still <S%H539><s%> at the voice <S%H6963><s%> of the trumpet. <S%H7782><s%>

"As often <S%H1767><s%> as the trumpet <S%H7782><s%> [sounds] he says, <S%H559><s%> 'Aha! <S%H1889><s%>' And he scents <S%H9552><s%> the battle <S%H4421><s%> from afar, <S%H7350><s%> And thunder <S%H7482><s%> of the captains, <S%H8269><s%> and the war <S%H8643><s%> cry. <S%H8643><s%>
"Is it by your understanding <S%H998><s%> that the hawk <S%H5322><s%> soars, <S%H82><s%> Stretching <S%H6566><s%> his wings <S%H3671><s%> toward the south <S%H8486><s%>?
"Is it at your command <S%H6310><s%> that the eagle <S%H5404><s%> mounts <S%H1361><s%> up, And makes <S%H7311><s%> his nest <S%H7064><s%> on high <S%H7311><s%>?
"On the cliff <S%H5553><s%> he dwells <S%H7931><s%> and lodges, <S%H3885><s%> Upon the rocky <S%H5553><s%> crag, <S%H8127><s%> an inaccessible <S%H4686><s%> place. <S%H4686><s%>
"From there <S%H8033><s%> he spies <S%H2658><s%> out food; <S%H400><s%> His eyes <S%H5869><s%> see <S%H5027><s%> [it] from afar. <S%H7350><s%>
"His young <S%H667><s%> ones <S%H667><s%> also suck <S%H5966><s%> up blood; <S%H1818><s%> And where <S%H834><s%> the slain <S%H2491><s%> are, there <S%H8033><s%> is he."
